docs.snippet: 9 P.M. (Hallmark) ACCIDENTALLY IN LOVE (2011) Jennie Garth (''Beverly Hills, 90210''), above, plays Annie, a widow and mother of a 6-year-old girl, Taylor (Dannika Northcott), who is losing her eyesight. Ethan Erickson is Eddie, the actor behind -...
docs.lead_paragraph: 9 P.M. (Hallmark) ACCIDENTALLY IN LOVE (2011) Jennie Garth (''Beverly Hills, 90210''), above, plays Annie, a widow and mother of a 6-year-old girl, Taylor (Dannika Northcott), who is losing her eyesight. Ethan Erickson is Eddie, the actor behind -- or rather, inside the costume of -- Mulligan the Rabbit, a popular children's television character, who, on his way to a film audition, crashes his car into Annie's. At first Eddie and Annie are enemies. And then, after Eddie invites Taylor onto the set of his show to meet Mulligan, whose human identity Eddie hasn't yet revealed, they're not. Soon Mulligan is paying for an experimental surgery that could give Taylor her vision back -- and Eddie is falling in love with Annie. Marilu Henner plays Annie's mother; Fred Willard is Eddie's manager. Peter Facinelli, Ms. Garth's husband, wrote the script. 8:15 A.M. (TCM) 31 DAYS OF OSCAR On Day 12, Turner Classic Movies presents the 10 best picture nominees from 1939: ''Dark Victory,'' at 8:15; ''Of Mice and Men,'' at 10; ''Ninotchka'' (with Greta Garbo, above), at noon; ''Wuthering Heights,'' at 2 p.m.; ''Stagecoach,'' at 4; ''Mr. Smith Goes to Washington,'' at 5:45; ''The Wizard of Oz,'' at 8; ''Gone With the Wind,'' the year's winner, at 10; ''Goodbye Mr. Chips,'' at 2 a.m.; and ''Love Affair'' at 4.

docs.snippet: The editors on many of David Fincher's movies talk about cutting down Aaron Sorkin's "Social Network" script without cutting too far, the director's superior visual sense and his habit of talking to himself....
docs.lead_paragraph: As a filmmaker, David Fincher has the reputation of an extreme perfectionist, so finely attuned to detail that he doesn't trust anyone else to get even minor secondary shots. That vision earned him an Oscar nomination as the director of "The Social Network" - but what about the guys who have to work with him? While Mr. Fincher is celebrated for doing dozens and dozens of takes , what's often forgotten is that other people then have to look at each and every one of those takes to put the film together. Apparently they don't mind; the editors Kirk Baxter and Angus Wall, and the sound designer, editor and mixer Ren Klyce have all worked with Mr. Fincher multiple times, on films like "The Curious Case of Benjamin Button" and "Zodiac." They are all Oscar-nominated for "The Social Network," and are working with Mr. Fincher on his next film, "The Girl with the Dragon Tattoo."
docs.abstract: The editors on many of David Fincher's movies talk about cutting down Aaron Sorkin's "Social Network" script without cutting too far, the director's superior visual sense and his habit of talking to himself.

docs.snippet: ABC, which will broadcast the Academy Awards ceremony on Feb. 27, has sold all the available advertising spots during the show....
docs.lead_paragraph: In another sign of the strength of the market for television commercial time, ABC, which will broadcast the Academy Awards ceremony on Feb. 27, has already sold all the available spots during the show.
docs.abstract: ABC, which will broadcast the Academy Awards ceremony on Feb. 27, has sold all the available advertising spots during the show.

headline.main: ABC Sells Out Ads on Oscars
